text: Hey <@U6W3H6YN8> -- How does the HubSpot gallery and this fit in -- is the HubSpot gallery doing some groundwork for this integration/workflow to see how all of that works at this point?

I don’t think the code gallery is being used in that way. I think it’s main goal is to spur open source collaboration in the community. Some things have definitely been learned from the project though(like the needs of file like objects)

The code gallery isn't being used in that way, but they are gathering "modules" so they can test implementation/syncing with the way they have it organized -- they can write a wrapper to make this stuff sync with the current system.. That is what I'm asking about, regardless of what it is being used for, this looks like an ideal spot to attempt to move stuff back and forth
ahh
It looks to me like the best starting point for that
vs ftp syncing
I would totally agree
I believe ftp is just a wrapper around the api...or am I backwards
no you’re completely correct, it is
The only other way I see this working is by implementing the same method of purchasing a module from the marketplace -- however that is implemented seems to be working for the most part
They could have other stuff going on in the background

The code gallery does have open source collaboration in the community at its roots, but the idea is someone could checkout code from github, and with a single command push a module or template or project into their portal.
^^^^ this
DO EEEEET!!!!!!
Which delivers to the portal, next step how you get that called into a template
that's where the fun is
<@UK3D64BRN> Thanks for asking the question that started this thread.  Looks like lots of us in the HubSpot dev community are looking to accomplish the same goals.
yeah, this is the juice that will definitely up the game :slightly_smiling_face:
<@U54TVT3C1> my pleasure!

We have a automatic sync to ftp in HubSpot. So we work locally in sublime to create our haml/scss/js files and push them into HubSpot as we make changes. But we do not have a full local environment where we are building the websites.
tell me more about this automatic sync
:point_up_2::skin-tone-2: Tell us all, more about this automatic sync
Anyone know if the shopify connector work with shopify plus? also the wholesale channel option of shopify? (also <@UBRG1R3EW> does Unific's connector work with ShopifyPlus?)

I would, but its a bit of secret sauce for us :wink:, but we also know HubSpot is planning on making changes that will break the way we work. So we are also waiting to see how much of a rebuild we need to do.

Although we aren’t building modules locally then pushing up. Not even sure how that would be accomplished :thinking_face:
i never liked secret sauces
like my sauce nice and open
i build my modules locally, but lack the auto syncing business
which is a pain point

I currently build modules 50/50 locally and design manager.

When dealing with fields and nesting, the GUI prevents my frustration of missing commas breaking my json
tru dat
<@U2H3TT8F2> yes, Unific works for ShopifyPlus as well :slightly_smiling_face:
I’ll DM you
Is the secret sauce made out of vinyl?
it uses cassette tapes and CDs
why is there no laser disk emoji?

Hello. Does anyone know if there are ways to configure the layout of the pop up forms?
I'm getting complex design for these that don't conform the the available layout in the pop up builder

it’s intentionally pretty limited as to what you can do from a design perspective… what i would recommend is building your own custom module which includes a form… and this is a good library for doing modal popups if you don’t want to hand code one <https://dimsemenov.com/plugins/magnific-popup/>

I think the answer is no but is there anyway to override the default language codes in a url for pages using HubSpot’s translation feature… for example instead of “/en-au/” could you just have “/au/“… of course a workaround solution is to NOT use the translation feature and just stand up another page with whatever slug you want but i do think the translation feature is handy (especially how it auto adds the hreflang and rel=“alternate” tags for search engines)

Not a big deal, but is anyone else annoyed that the Source Code for a page is a 2 click process? Right now, theres only 1 thing under Advanced (i.e., Source Code), and making it a 2 step process seems unecessary. Is there any way that Advanced can just become Source Code, or are more things comnig to the Advanced dropdown?
HS staff stated they intentionally did this, claimed too many marketers were jacking up their sites causing support hell
Blast, makes sense though
agreed, would be nice to have a way to toggle that off
I don’t think I can force it via the <#CBBAW6Z3R|community-browser-extension> in a performant or safe way unfortunately
Add a developer role in the HubSpot portal that gets rid of these barriers?
obviously would be a HS thing to do though

yea a developer role type thing is something that’s been talked about a lot, on HubSpots end they’d like to keep things granular like how permissions are now, but with maybe more tools to make it easier to use
Heybguys
We just push a new home page
Any idea what’s that?
it would be a preview template
are you linking to the preview at all?
Nop
I published my pages
what is it that you are using that pulled the active stats? was it GA?
Yep
Real Time
<https://pro.chronogolf.com/>
and <http://www.chronogolf.com|www.chronogolf.com>
thats really odd, are they using any filters in GA? You could always add a hostname include filter so it will only sow traffic from the proper hostname
might help alleviate this
I’ll check :slightly_smiling_face:
<https://pro.chronogolf.com/fr/blog/29-id%C3%A9es-de-marketing-pour-les-clubs-de-golf> idea 21
that links to a preview page
I have this : <http://hs-sites.origin.HubSpot.net|hs-sites.origin.HubSpot.net> in my Hostname
thought I dont think that would cause this issue you are seeing
How did you find that?
We use Screaming Frog here that can crawl a site and report on it
<https://www.screamingfrog.co.uk/seo-spider/>
Ok great :slightly_smiling_face:
Thanks!
It disapear from the top 20 Real Time pages a few minutes ago
Weird
Anyone know what could be that (find in GA) ?
<@U22PJPGK0> Maybe ? :slightly_smiling_face:
maybe even <@U6W3H6YN8>?
woah, thats a huge spike in traffic from that domain. <@U6GNQ7JBU> do you happen to know what this subdomain on HS is used for?
Hi, anyone has send a information of a form to third and without risk of vulnerabilities?

Anyone have experience using the ICON MODULE inside of a custom module?  When I add the snippet of HubL and render the page it just spits out plain text:

{name=angellist, unicode=f209, type=REGULAR}

This is the HubL I’m adding to my custom module:

{% icon
	name=“{{ module.content_group.column_1.icon_hs.name }}”
	style=“{{ module.content_group.column_1.icon_hs.type }}”
	unicode=“{{ module.content_group.column_1.icon_hs.unicode }}”
%}

Any help is massively appreciated.
it’s a font i belive
Yes, it uses Font Awesome. But the HTML markup isn’t rendering like font awesome.
if it’s font awsome then maybe add the {{ module.content_group.column_1.icon_hs.name }} as a class in <i class=“fa fa-address-book” aria-hidden=“true”></i>
<i class=“fa fa-{{ module.content_group.column_1.icon_hs.name }}” aria-hidden=“true”></i>
try that
I appreciate the ideas. When I do that it just outputs that as the same text.
{{ module.content_group.column_1.icon_hs.name|pprint }}
what does this spit out?
is this from hubdb? content_group.column_1.icon_hs

it should be: {% icon
	name=“{{ module.icon.name }}”
	style=“{{ module.icon.type }}”
	unicode=“{{ module.icon.unicode }}”
%}

{% icon
	name=“{{ module.FIELD_NAME.name }}”
	style=“{{ module.FIELD_NAME.type }}”
	unicode=“{{ module.FIELD_NAME.unicode }}”
%}
work at my end
using just the {{ module.FIELD_NAME.name }} prints angellist
anyway … good luck … it’s 2am … going to bed
No, it’s not from HubDB as far as I know.
The Hubl that you pasted is exactly what I’m using. That’s the weird thing.
Yes you only need the name part ... but why do you have so many nods
I’ll keep trying. Thanks for your help, Adrian.
Module.content.column.icon
You should only have 2 dots :)
Anyway ... good luck
What happened with the pprint
Just looking from my phone.  Adrian's suggestion of pretty printing should have led you in the right direction
That's the same as your built-in domains like <http://portalId.hs-sites.net|portalId.hs-sites.net>
but with that url, it would be <http://preview.hs-sites.com|preview.hs-sites.com>
Got it working. Thanks for your help @guys!
Would the origin domain have to do with a site that uses multilingual?
